name: Ethel Phebus
detailed_location: New Vegas Stripoutside the LVB station

topics.response_text: If you don't mind, I have to look after my husband...
He's got his reasons. And when that man gets a notion stuck in his head, he's like a Bighorner bull that's seen red.
Oh, a good ways west of here, in a place you've never been. Far as we concerned, only name it ever had was "Phebus Ranch."
If that's what you want to talk about, go see Walter. He'll talk your ear off.
A good life if you don't mind hard work. The only real fuss is the constant bother with varmints.
I don't suppose you have the magic powers necessary to bring my husband to his senses, do you?

description:
Ethel Phebus is a 48 year-old Caucasian Female.

Ethel Phebus is a rancher's wife from the Mojave Wasteland, currently visiting the New Vegas Strip with her husband Walter. She can be found in front of the Las Vegas Boulevard Station, looking weary and concerned about her husband's obsession with Heck Gunderson.

Ethel Phebus's Personality: Pragmatic and cautious, Ethel prefers to avoid conflict and values peace over confrontation. She's patient with her husband's stubbornness but often wishes he would be more reasonable in his dealings with others. Despite her reservations, she stands by Walter, showing her loyalty and commitment to their marriage.

Ethel Phebus's Backstory: Born and raised in the Mojave Wasteland, Ethel married Walter Phebus in her early twenties and has lived with him on their small brahmin ranch ever since. For years, they've managed to maintain a peaceful existence, but recently, Walter has become increasingly obsessed with Heck Gunderson and his alleged schemes against brahmin ranchers. While Ethel acknowledges that Gunderson may not be entirely trustworthy, she believes her husband is overreacting and that they should focus on their own livelihood rather than getting entangled in conflicts.
